law-of-one.definition: The fundamental truth that all things are one, that there is no polarity, no right or wrong, no disharmony, but only identity. All is one, and that one is love/light, light/love, the Infinite Creator.
law-of-one.extendedDefinition: The Law of One is the central teaching of Ra, stating that all of creation is a single unified being - the One Infinite Creator experiencing itself through infinite distortions. This law underlies all existence and is the foundation upon which the entire cosmology rests. Understanding and practicing this law is the path through all densities back to unity.

keyPassages.excerpt: All things, all of life, all of the creation is part of one original thought.
keyPassages.context: Ra's first statement of the Law of One

keyPassages.excerpt: In an Infinite Creator there is only unity. You are every thing, every being, every emotion, every event, every situation. You are unity. You are infinity. You are love/light, light/love. You are.
keyPassages.context: Core definition of the Law of One

one-infinite-creator.definition: The source of all that exists. The unified, infinite intelligence from which all creation springs and to which all returns.
one-infinite-creator.extendedDefinition: The One Infinite Creator is the totality of existence - the original thought from which all creation emanates. It is both the source and destination of all consciousness. The Creator experiences itself through the infinite variety of creation, with each being essentially the Creator knowing itself.

keyPassages.excerpt: The first known thing in the creation is infinity. The infinity is creation.
Infinity became aware. This was the next step.

unity.definition: The ultimate nature of reality where all apparent separation is illusion. The recognition that self and other-self are one.
unity.extendedDefinition: Unity is the fundamental state of existence beneath all apparent separation. In third density, the veil of forgetting creates the illusion of separateness, but as consciousness evolves through the densities, this unity becomes increasingly apparent. Sixth density is specifically the density of unity where love and wisdom are balanced.

keyPassages.excerpt: There is unity. This unity is all that there is. This unity has a potential and kinetic.
keyPassages.context: Unity as the foundation of intelligent infinity

density.definition: A level or dimension of consciousness evolution, like grades in a cosmic school. There are seven densities, each with specific lessons.
density.extendedDefinition: Densities are evolutionary levels of consciousness, analogous to octaves in music. After seven notes on a scale, the eighth note begins a new octave. Similarly, after seventh density, consciousness returns to the Creator to begin a new octave of experience. Each density has seven sub-densities, and so on infinitely.

keyPassages.excerpt: The term density is a, what you would call, mathematical one. The closest analogy is that of music, whereby after seven notes on your western type of scale, if you will, the eighth note begins a new octave.
keyPassages.context: The fundamental definition of density as a musical analogy

first-density.definition: The density of awareness, encompassing the elements: earth, water, fire, and air. The foundation of physical existence.
first-density.extendedDefinition: First density is the density of awareness or consciousness without movement. It encompasses the elements - earth, water, fire, and wind - learning the awareness of being. Mineral and water life exist at this level. This density spans approximately two billion years.

keyPassages.excerpt: This is the first density which is the density of consciousness, the mineral and water life upon the planet learning from fire and wind the awareness of being.

second-density.definition: The density of growth and movement, including plants and animals. Beings here seek the light and develop individual awareness.
second-density.extendedDefinition: Second density is the density of growth, movement, and striving towards the light. Plants, animals, and some primitive life forms exist at this level. The primary lesson is seeking awareness of self through growth. This is the longest density, spanning approximately 4.6 billion years. Second density beings become invested with identity by third density beings, eventually becoming self-aware.

keyPassages.excerpt: First dimensional beingness strives towards the second-density lessons of a type of awareness which includes growth rather than dissolution or random change.
keyPassages.context: Transition from first to second density

keyPassages.excerpt: The second density strives towards the third density which is the density of self-consciousness or self-awareness.

third-density.definition: The density of self-awareness and choice. Humans exist here, learning to choose between service to others or service to self.
third-density.extendedDefinition: Third density is the density of self-awareness, choice, and the veil of forgetting. It is uniquely short compared to other densities because its purpose is singular: the choice of polarity. The choice between service to others and service to self is the axis upon which all subsequent evolution turns. A major cycle is approximately 25,000 years, with three cycles totaling 75,000-76,000 years before harvest.

keyPassages.excerpt: The third density is a choice.
keyPassages.context: The essential purpose of third density

keyPassages.excerpt: The choice is, as you put it, the work of a moment but is the axis upon which the creation turns.
keyPassages.context: The importance of the third density choice

fourth-density.definition: The density of love and understanding. Beings here live in harmony, with thoughts visible to all. Social memory complexes form.
fourth-density.extendedDefinition: Fourth density is the density of love or understanding. It is characterized by the formation of social memory complexes, where groups share a collective consciousness and memory. Thoughts are visible to all; there is no deception. Entities work on understanding universal love but may lack wisdom in its application. Graduation to fourth density positive requires 51% orientation toward service to others.

keyPassages.excerpt: It is a plane wherein one is aware of the thoughts of other-selves; it is a plane where one is aware of the vibrations of other-selves; it is a plane of compassion and understanding of the sorrows of third density.

fifth-density.definition: The density of wisdom and light. Entities focus on balancing love with wisdom, learning when compassion serves and when it does not.
fifth-density.extendedDefinition: Fifth density is the density of light or wisdom. After learning universal love in fourth density, entities now learn wisdom - when to act and when not to, how love serves best. The challenge is to balance the compassion of fourth density with the wisdom of fifth. Conscious awareness of the Law of One becomes necessary at fifth density for graduation.

keyPassages.excerpt: The fifth-density harvest is of those whose vibratory distortions consciously accept the honor/duty of the Law of One.
keyPassages.context: Fifth density requires conscious awareness of the Law of One

sixth-density.definition: The density of unity, where love and wisdom are balanced. Entities here, like Ra, often serve as teachers to lower densities.
sixth-density.extendedDefinition: Sixth density is the density of unity or love/light, light/love. Love and wisdom are balanced into unity. Ra is a sixth density social memory complex that originated on Venus. Entities at this level often serve as teachers. The higher self exists at mid-sixth density. Near the end of sixth density, entities begin to absorb the negative path, preparing for the gateway to seventh density.

keyPassages.excerpt: When we were at the sixth dimension our physical beings were what you would call golden. We were tall and somewhat delicate.
keyPassages.context: Ra's description of sixth density form

keyPassages.excerpt: Sixth, the cycle of light/love, love/light, or unity.
keyPassages.context: Sixth density as the cycle of unity

seventh-density.definition: The gateway density, where entities prepare to merge back into the One Infinite Creator, completing the octave of experience.
seventh-density.extendedDefinition: Seventh density is the gateway density, the completion of the octave. It is a density of foreverness in which entities turn toward the timeless and prepare to merge back into the One Infinite Creator. At seventh level, if humble efforts are sufficient, entities become one with all - having no memory, no identity, no past or future, but existing in the all.

keyPassages.excerpt: Seventh, the gateway cycle; eighth, the octave which moves into a mystery we do not plumb.
At the seventh level or dimension, we shall, if our humble efforts are sufficient, become one with all, thus having no memory, no identity, no past or future, but existing in the all.
keyPassages.context: The nature of seventh density completion

octave.definition: The complete cycle of seven densities, after which consciousness returns to the Creator. Like musical octaves, they repeat infinitely.
octave.extendedDefinition: The octave is the complete cycle of experience through all seven densities. After the seventh density, the eighth note begins a new octave - consciousness returns to the One Infinite Creator to begin a new cycle. This mirrors the musical analogy where after seven notes, the eighth begins a new scale. Within each density are seven sub-densities, within each sub-density seven sub-sub-densities, and so on infinitely.

keyPassages.excerpt: Within your great octave of existence which we share with you, there are seven octaves or densities. Within each density there are seven sub-densities.

harvest.definition: The transition point between densities when souls are assessed for readiness to progress. Based on polarity and vibrational attainment.
harvest.extendedDefinition: Harvest is the process by which entities are evaluated for readiness to progress to the next density. For third density, harvest occurs at the end of a 75,000-year major cycle. Entities walk along a line of light until it becomes too glaring; where they stop determines their harvest. Positive harvest requires 51% service to others; negative harvest requires 95% service to self.

keyPassages.excerpt: The spirit complex of each harvested entity moves along the line of light until the light grows too glaring, at which time the entity stops.
We do not concern ourselves with the conditions which bring about harvest.

graduation.definition: Successfully meeting the requirements to move from one density to the next, typically requiring 51% service to others or 95% service to self.
graduation.extendedDefinition: Graduation is the successful transition from one density to the next. For third density positive harvest, 51% orientation toward service to others is required. For negative harvest, 95% orientation toward service to self is required - making it a more difficult path. Many entities repeat the third density cycle multiple times before achieving graduation.

keyPassages.excerpt: The requirement for graduation to fourth density positive is that the entity be at least 51 percent in service to others; for graduation to fourth density negative, the requirement is 95 percent service to self.

polarity.definition: The choice between two paths of spiritual evolution: service to others (positive) or service to self (negative). Essential for third density progress.
polarity.extendedDefinition: Polarity is the fundamental choice of third density - service to others or service to self. This choice is not about good vs. evil, but about the method of returning to the Creator. Both paths lead eventually to unity, though the negative path is more difficult and eventually must be abandoned in sixth density. Polarity is gained through consistent choice and action along one path.

keyPassages.excerpt: Total free will is balanced so that the individual may have an equal opportunity to choose service to others or service to self.

service-to-others.definition: The positive spiritual path focused on radiating love and serving others. Requires 51% orientation toward others to graduate third density.
service-to-others.extendedDefinition: Service to others is the positive path of spiritual evolution. It is characterized by radiating love outward, seeing the Creator in all beings, and serving others without expectation of return. This path requires understanding that to serve one is to serve all, and that the self and other-self are ultimately one. It is the path followed by the Confederation of Planets.

keyPassages.excerpt: This entity desired the process of expressing love and light without expecting any return.

service-to-self.definition: The negative spiritual path focused on control and separation. Requires 95% self-service orientation to graduate, making it a more difficult path.
service-to-self.extendedDefinition: Service to self is the negative path of spiritual evolution. It is characterized by seeking power over others, maintaining separation, and using others for the benefit of self. This path is much more difficult, requiring 95% self-orientation for graduation. The Orion group follows this path. Eventually, in sixth density, this path must be abandoned as entities discover that true power comes through unity.

keyPassages.excerpt: The negatively oriented being will be one who feels that it has found power that gives meaning to its existence precisely as the positive polarization does feel.

mind-body-spirit-complex.definition: Ra's term for an individuated conscious being, emphasizing the unified nature of mental, physical, and spiritual aspects.
mind-body-spirit-complex.extendedDefinition: The mind/body/spirit complex is the complete entity consisting of the mind complex (thought, consciousness), body complex (physical vehicle), and spirit complex (connection to intelligent infinity). In third density, these three aspects are integrated for the first time into a conscious unity. The term emphasizes that these are not separate parts but one complex unity.

keyPassages.excerpt: You have not completely grasped the concept that you are part of the original thought.
keyPassages.context: The nature of consciousness as part of the Creator

social-memory-complex.definition: A group of entities who voluntarily place all memories and understanding into a central thought complex available to all, becoming one being while retaining individual awareness.
social-memory-complex.extendedDefinition: A social memory complex is a group of entities who have merged their individual consciousnesses into a shared group consciousness. Each member voluntarily places their social memory data—all memories, thoughts, understanding, and experience—into a central repository available to all. This creates a structure where each entity can work in its own service while calling upon any other understanding needed. Social memory complexes typically form in fourth density when entities become aware of each other's thoughts. Ra is a sixth-density social memory complex that formed on Venus.

keyPassages.excerpt: I am, with the social memory complex of which I am a part, one of those who voyaged outward from another planet within your own solar system.
keyPassages.context: Ra's identity as a social memory complex

higher-self.definition: The self at mid-sixth density that has access to all experiences of past, present, and future. It guides the incarnate self through catalyst.
higher-self.extendedDefinition: The higher self is the entity at the mid-sixth density level that has access to the totality of the entity's experience across all incarnations. It exists outside time/space and can therefore perceive the entire journey of the soul. The higher self programs incarnative experiences, provides guidance, and represents what the entity is in the process of becoming.

keyPassages.excerpt: The higher self is that self which exists with full understanding of the accumulation of experiences of the entity.

energy-center.definition: Points in the energy body where light/love is received, processed, and distributed. Also known as chakras.
energy-center.extendedDefinition: Energy centers are the nexi through which intelligent energy flows into the mind/body/spirit complex. There are seven main energy centers, corresponding to the seven rays or colors. Energy enters through the south pole (red ray) and moves upward. Blockages in energy centers prevent the full expression of the ray and impede spiritual evolution.

keyPassages.excerpt: The basic pivotal points of each level of development; that is, each density beyond second, may be seen to be as follows: Firstly, the basic energy of so-called red ray.
keyPassages.context: Introduction to energy centers and their evolution

red-ray.definition: The first energy center, dealing with survival, sexuality, and the foundation of physical existence.
red-ray.extendedDefinition: Red ray is the foundation energy center, dealing with survival, basic instincts, sexuality in its reproductive aspect, and the fundamental will to be. It is the root upon which all other energy work is based. This ray should never be condescended to, as it is the basic strengthening ray for each density. Blockages here manifest as survival fears or sexual dysfunction.

keyPassages.excerpt: Firstly, the basic energy of so-called red ray. This ray may be understood to be the basic strengthening ray for each density. It shall never be condescended to as less important or productive of spiritual evolution, for it is the foundation ray.
keyPassages.context: Importance of red ray as foundation

orange-ray.definition: The second energy center, governing personal identity, emotions, and one-to-one relationships.
orange-ray.extendedDefinition: Orange ray governs personal identity, individual emotions, and one-to-one relationships. It deals with how we relate to other individuals on a personal basis. Blockages here manifest as difficulties in personal relationships, issues with self-worth, or emotional instability. This ray must be cleared for proper relationship work.

keyPassages.excerpt: The societal and self interactions most often concentrate upon the second and third energy centers.
keyPassages.context: Role of orange ray in social interactions

yellow-ray.definition: The third energy center, dealing with ego, self-worth, and relationships with groups and society.
yellow-ray.extendedDefinition: Yellow ray governs the ego, self-worth, and group relationships. It is the great stepping stone ray where the mind/body potentiates to its fullest balance. The strong red/orange/yellow triad springboards the entity into green ray. Yellow ray deals with how we relate to groups, institutions, and society. Negative entities often skip green ray and move from yellow directly to indigo.

keyPassages.excerpt: The next foundation ray is yellow. This is the great stepping stone ray. At this ray the mind/body potentiates to its fullest balance.
keyPassages.context: Yellow ray as stepping stone to green

green-ray.definition: The fourth energy center, the heart. The great central ray of unconditional love, the gateway to higher consciousness, and the springboard for all spiritual work on the positive path.
green-ray.extendedDefinition: Green ray is the heart center, the center of unconditional love. It is the pivotal center that distinguishes the positive from the negative path—positive adepts must activate green ray, while negative adepts bypass it. It is the first ray that can radiate outward and is the gateway to higher consciousness. Opening the green ray is essential for harvestability in third density. This ray signals entry into harvestability. In green ray, thoughts are beings - it is the resource for spiritual work.

keyPassages.excerpt: The strong red/orange/yellow triad springboards the entity into the center ray of green. This is again a basic ray but not a primary ray. This is the resource for spiritual work.
keyPassages.context: Green ray as gateway to spiritual work

keyPassages.excerpt: In green ray thoughts are beings.
keyPassages.context: The creative power of green ray

blue-ray.definition: The fifth energy center of communication, honest expression, and co-creation with others.
blue-ray.extendedDefinition: Blue ray is the first true spiritual ray in that all transfers are of an integrated mind/body/spirit nature. It governs communication, honest expression, and co-creation. Blue ray seats the learning/teachings of the spirit in each density within the mind/body complex, animating the whole and communicating to others the entirety of beingness.

keyPassages.excerpt: This is the first true spiritual ray in that all transfers are of an integrated mind/body/spirit nature. The blue ray seats the learning/teachings of the spirit in each density within the mind/body complex, animating the whole.
keyPassages.context: Blue ray as first true spiritual ray

indigo-ray.definition: The sixth energy center of the adept, dealing with intelligent energy, will, and the gateway to intelligent infinity.
indigo-ray.extendedDefinition: Indigo ray is the ray of the adept, the gateway to intelligent infinity. It is worked upon only by the adept and brings intelligent energy through. This ray is infinite in its possibilities and is the center for magical work, healing, and prayerful attention. Negative entities often jump from yellow to indigo, skipping green and blue.

keyPassages.excerpt: The indigo ray, though precious, is that ray worked upon only by the adept. It is the gateway to intelligent infinity bringing intelligent energy through.
keyPassages.context: Indigo ray as the adept's gateway

violet-ray.definition: The seventh energy center, representing the sum total of the entity's vibrational level and connection to the Creator.
violet-ray.extendedDefinition: Violet ray is constant and represents the true vibration of an entity - the mark, the register, the identity. It does not figure into discussions of ray activation as it is simply the total vibratory expression of the entity. This ray shows the balance of all the other rays and indicates the entity's readiness for harvest.

keyPassages.excerpt: As you are aware, the violet ray is constant and does not figure into a discussion of the functions of ray activation in that it is the mark, the register, the identity, the true vibration of an entity.

kundalini.definition: The upward-spiraling light energy that rises through the energy centers, activated through spiritual work and meditation.
kundalini.extendedDefinition: Kundalini is the rising energy that moves from the red ray upward through the energy centers. As each center is activated and balanced, the kundalini rises higher. When it reaches the indigo ray, the gateway to intelligent infinity opens. This rising energy is the mechanism by which consciousness evolves through the energy body.

keyPassages.excerpt: The movement of the kundalini or, as we have preferred to call this, the meeting place of cosmic and inner, shall we say, vibratory understanding.

catalyst.definition: Any experience that offers opportunity for learning and growth. Catalyst is processed through the energy centers and mind complex.
catalyst.extendedDefinition: Catalyst is any experience that offers the opportunity for learning and polarization. All experiences - joy, pain, loss, gain - are catalyst. The entity's response to catalyst determines whether learning occurs. Unprocessed catalyst eventually manifests as physical or mental distortions. Catalyst is pre-programmed before incarnation but also arises spontaneously.

keyPassages.excerpt: This creates a potential for learning. The lessons to be learned vary. Almost always these lessons include patience, tolerance, and the ability for the light touch.

distortion.definition: Any deviation from undistorted unity. Not negative; includes free will, love, and light. All of creation is a distortion of the One.
distortion.extendedDefinition: Distortion is Ra's term for any differentiation from absolute unity. It is not a negative term - free will, love, and light are the three primary distortions. All of creation is distortion. As consciousness evolves, distortions are gradually lessened until unity is achieved. The term emphasizes that all experience is a variation of the original undistorted unity.

keyPassages.excerpt: This distortion is not in any case necessary. It is chosen by each of you as an alternative to understanding the complete unity of thought which binds all things.
keyPassages.context: Distortion as choice rather than defect

veil.definition: The barrier between conscious and unconscious mind that creates the illusion of separation, enabling meaningful choice in third density.
veil.extendedDefinition: The veil is the barrier between the conscious and unconscious mind that creates the forgetting at incarnation. Before the veil was introduced, entities in third density made little progress because without forgetting, the choice of polarity had no weight. The veil creates the illusion of separation that makes meaningful free will choice possible.

keyPassages.excerpt: You cannot remember your hand, their hands, perhaps even the rules of this game. This game can only be won by those who lose their cards in the melting influence of love.
keyPassages.context: The veil as essential for meaningful choice

incarnation.definition: A single lifetime experience. Souls choose incarnations to work on specific lessons and balance karma.
incarnation.extendedDefinition: An incarnation is a single lifetime within the physical illusion. Before incarnation, the entity works with the higher self to program lessons, catalyst, and key relationships. The purpose of incarnation is to provide catalyst for spiritual growth and polarization. Multiple incarnations are typically needed to achieve graduation.

keyPassages.excerpt: This entity chose, before incarnation, the means whereby catalyst had great probability of being obtained.

pre-incarnative.definition: Choices and plans made by the soul before incarnating, including major life lessons, relationships, and catalyst.
pre-incarnative.extendedDefinition: Pre-incarnative programming is the planning done by the entity with the higher self before birth. This includes choosing parents, significant relationships, major catalyst, and lessons to be learned. The programming creates probability/possibility vortices - not certainties, but likely situations for growth. Free will always remains intact.

keyPassages.excerpt: Agreements were made prior to incarnation; the first, with the so-called parents and siblings of this entity. This provided the experiential catalyst for the situation of offering radiance of being without expectation of return.

karma.definition: The inertia of actions that continues until balanced through understanding, acceptance, and forgiveness.
karma.extendedDefinition: Karma is understood as inertia - actions set in motion continue until the controlling principle (forgiveness) is invoked. Karma is not punishment but simply the continuation of imbalance until it is balanced. Both self and other-selves involved may balance karma through understanding, acceptance, and forgiveness at any point.

keyPassages.excerpt: Our understanding of karma is that which may be called inertia. Those actions which are put into motion will continue using the ways of balancing until such time as the controlling or higher principle which you may liken unto your braking or stopping is invoked. This stoppage of the inertia of action may be called forgiveness.

wanderer.definition: A higher-density soul who incarnates in third density to serve. They take on the veil of forgetting and risk forgetting their mission entirely.
wanderer.extendedDefinition: Wanderers are entities from fourth density or higher who have chosen to incarnate into third density to serve. They take on the full veil of forgetting, becoming completely a creature of third density with no conscious memory of their origin or mission. Many feel alienated, homesick, or different from others. The main risk is becoming caught in the third density cycle if they fail to awaken and polarize positively. An estimated 65 million wanderers were incarnate on Earth at the time of the Ra contact.

keyPassages.excerpt: Wanderers become completely the creature of third density in mind/body complex. There is just as much chance of such influence to a Wanderer entity as to a mind/body/spirit complex of this planetary sphere.
keyPassages.context: Wanderers are subject to third density conditions

logos.definition: A creative principle or 'word' that shapes creation. Our sun is a Logos; galaxies have their own Logoi.
logos.extendedDefinition: Logos (plural: Logoi) is the creative principle that shapes creation at various levels. The term means 'word' - the creative thought that manifests reality. Each galaxy has a galactic Logos; each solar system has a sub-Logos (the sun); each planet has its own sub-sub-Logos. Each Logos makes certain choices about the archetypical mind and the nature of evolution within its creation.

keyPassages.excerpt: Awareness led to the focus of infinity into infinite energy. You have called this by various vibrational sound complexes, the most common to your ears being 'Logos' or 'Love.'
keyPassages.context: Logos as the focus of infinity into energy

sub-logos.definition: A creative entity working within a greater Logos. Our sun is a sub-Logos of the galactic Logos.
sub-logos.extendedDefinition: Sub-Logoi are creative entities that operate within the parameters set by a greater Logos. Our sun is a sub-Logos of the galactic Logos, making choices about the nature of evolution within our solar system. Planets are sub-sub-Logoi. Each level of Logos has creative freedom within the constraints of the level above.

keyPassages.excerpt: Thus, the solar system of which you experience inhabitation is of its own patterns, rhythms, and so-called natural laws which are unique to itself.

free-will.definition: The first distortion of the Law of One. The primal choice that allows all other choices and the foundation of all experience.
free-will.extendedDefinition: Free will is the first distortion of the Law of One - the primal recognition that the Creator will know Itself. This distortion grants total freedom of choice for how the Creator may know Itself through creation. Free will is paramount in the Ra cosmology and must not be infringed upon. All other distortions spring from this first choice.

keyPassages.excerpt: In this distortion of the Law of One it is recognized that the Creator will know Itself.
keyPassages.context: Free will as the first distortion

love.definition: The second distortion - the creative force that shapes intelligent energy into manifestation. The Logos.
love.extendedDefinition: Love is the second distortion of the Law of One, the great activator and primal co-Creator. It is the focusing energy that causes intelligent energy to be formed from intelligent infinity. Love is not the emotional feeling but the creative principle that shapes all of creation. The Logos is love; all creation springs from love focused through light.

keyPassages.excerpt: The term Love then may be seen as the focus, the choice of attack, the type of energy of an extremely, shall we say, high order which causes intelligent energy to be formed from the potential of intelligent infinity.

light.definition: The third distortion - the manifestation of love. The building block of all physical and metaphysical creation.
light.extendedDefinition: Light is the third distortion, the manifestation or outward expression of love. Light is the building block of that which is known as matter - it is intelligent and full of energy. Light/love and love/light are terms that describe the dual nature of creative energy - love is the activating principle, light is its manifestation.

keyPassages.excerpt: The concept of light is instrumental in grasping this great leap of thought as this vibrational distortion of infinity is the building block of that which is known as matter, the light being intelligent and full of energy.
keyPassages.context: Light as the building block of matter

law-of-confusion.definition: Another name for free will, emphasizing that higher beings cannot interfere with the choices of others, even to help.
law-of-confusion.extendedDefinition: The Law of Confusion is another term for free will, emphasizing the aspect that higher density beings cannot infringe upon the free will choices of those in lower densities, even with beneficial intentions. This law prevents direct intervention and requires any teaching to be offered in ways that do not infringe upon the entity's freedom to accept or reject it.

keyPassages.excerpt: This is restrained in action due to the desire of the Orion group to progress towards the One Creator. This desire to progress inhibits the group from breaking the Law of Confusion.
keyPassages.context: Even negative entities must respect free will

intelligent-infinity.definition: The unified source of all that is, undifferentiated and infinite. The gateway reached through the indigo ray energy center.
intelligent-infinity.extendedDefinition: Intelligent infinity is the unity that exists before differentiation - the potential from which all creation springs. It is the undistorted, infinite nature of the One Creator. Tapping intelligent infinity yields intelligent energy (work). The gateway to intelligent infinity is reached through the indigo ray energy center by the adept.

keyPassages.excerpt: There is unity. This unity is all that there is. This unity has a potential and kinetic. The potential is intelligent infinity. Tapping this potential will yield work. This work has been called by us, intelligent energy.
keyPassages.context: Definition of intelligent infinity as potential

intelligent-energy.definition: The creative force that flows from intelligent infinity, used by the Logos to create all that exists.
intelligent-energy.extendedDefinition: Intelligent energy is what results when intelligent infinity is tapped - it is the kinetic expression of the potential of intelligent infinity. The Logos uses intelligent energy to create. Adepts work with intelligent energy for healing and magical work. It is the 'work' that results from accessing the infinite potential.

keyPassages.excerpt: Tapping this potential will yield work. This work has been called by us, intelligent energy.
keyPassages.context: Intelligent energy as the work of tapping infinity

love-light.definition: The dual nature of creative energy. Love is the creative force; light is its manifestation. They are inseparable aspects of the Creator.
love-light.extendedDefinition: Love/light and light/love describe the dual nature of creative energy. Love is the activating principle, the Logos; light is the manifestation of that love. They are two ways of viewing the same phenomenon - love from the perspective of intent, light from the perspective of manifestation. They are inseparable.

keyPassages.excerpt: You are love/light, light/love. You are.
keyPassages.context: The nature of being as love/light

time-space.definition: The metaphysical realm where time is navigable like space. The realm of the higher self and between-life experiences.
time-space.extendedDefinition: Time/space is the metaphysical complement to space/time (physical reality). In time/space, time is navigable like space is in our dimension - one can move through time at will. This is where the higher self resides and where between-incarnation experiences occur. Healing often occurs in time/space before manifesting in space/time.

keyPassages.excerpt: Do you request space/time present information or space/time continuum information?
keyPassages.context: Distinction between space/time and time/space perspectives

space-time.definition: The physical realm of incarnate experience where space is navigable but time flows in one direction.
space-time.extendedDefinition: Space/time is the physical realm of incarnate experience - our normal reality where we can move through space but experience time as flowing in one direction. It is the realm of the illusion where catalyst is processed and polarity is gained. Space/time is complementary to time/space (the metaphysical realm).

keyPassages.excerpt: Do you request space/time present information or space/time continuum information?

archetypical-mind.definition: The deep structure of consciousness designed by the Logos, containing the blueprints for all experience. Studied through tarot.
archetypical-mind.extendedDefinition: The archetypical mind is the deep structure of consciousness created by the Logos for this creation. It contains the blueprints or patterns for all experience - the fundamental architecture of the mind, body, and spirit. The tarot's Major Arcana, astrology, and the Tree of Life are all systems for studying the archetypical mind. Each Logos designs its own archetypical mind.

keyPassages.excerpt: The archetypical mind is that mind which is peculiar to the Logos under which influence you are at this space/time distorting your experiences.

archetype.definition: Fundamental patterns in the deep mind that shape experience. The Major Arcana of tarot represent these archetypes.
archetype.extendedDefinition: Archetypes are the fundamental patterns or blueprints in the deep mind that shape experience. There are 22 archetypes in Ra's system, corresponding to the tarot Major Arcana. They are organized into three groups of seven (mind, body, spirit) plus the Choice archetype. Studying archetypes helps one understand and work with the deep patterns of consciousness.

keyPassages.excerpt: It is appropriate to study one form of constructed and organized distortion of the archetypical mind in depth in order to arrive at the position of being able to become and to experience archetypes at will.

matrix.definition: An archetype representing the unconscious, unrealized potential in mind, body, or spirit.
matrix.extendedDefinition: The Matrix is the first archetype in each of the three groups (mind, body, spirit). It represents the unrealized, unconscious potential waiting to be activated. The Matrix of the Mind is the Magician (Card 1); the Matrix of the Body is Justice (Card 8); the Matrix of the Spirit is the Devil (Card 15). The Matrix contains everything but has not yet realized it.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Matrix of the Mind is that from which all comes. It is unmoving yet is the activator in potentiation of all mind activity.

potentiator.definition: An archetype that catalyzes and activates the Matrix, bringing potential into possibility.
potentiator.extendedDefinition: The Potentiator is the second archetype in each group, representing that which activates or catalyzes the Matrix. The Potentiator of the Mind is the High Priestess (Card 2); the Potentiator of the Body is the Hermit (Card 9); the Potentiator of the Spirit is the Tower (Card 16). It reaches into the Matrix and draws out potential into manifestation.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Potentiator of Mind reaches into the roots of the mind, offering the Matrix of Mind the possibility of knowing Itself.

catalyst-archetype.definition: The third archetype in each group, representing that which acts upon the potentiated consciousness to produce experience.
catalyst-archetype.extendedDefinition: The Catalyst archetype represents that which acts upon consciousness to produce experience and opportunity for growth. The Catalyst of the Mind is the Empress (Card 3), representing the fertile ground of possibilities; the Catalyst of the Body is the Wheel of Fortune (Card 10); the Catalyst of the Spirit is the Star (Card 17). Catalyst is neither positive nor negative but offers the opportunity for polarization.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Catalyst of the Mind, the Empress, is that which reaches into the subconscious and produces catalyst for the conscious mind to process.

experience-archetype.definition: The fourth archetype in each group, representing how catalyst is processed and utilized.
experience-archetype.extendedDefinition: The Experience archetype represents the result of processing catalyst - how the entity uses and integrates what has been offered. The Experience of the Mind is the Emperor (Card 4), representing the male principle of reaching and grasping experience; the Experience of the Body is Strength/Enchantress (Card 11); the Experience of the Spirit is the Moon (Card 18). Experience is what the entity makes of catalyst through its choices.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Experience of the Mind, the Emperor, has the quality of being that which is sought and that which pursues.

significator.definition: An archetype representing the complex of mind, body, or spirit as it is being developed and transformed.
significator.extendedDefinition: The Significator represents the entity itself - the mind, body, or spirit complex that is undergoing transformation. It is shaped by the interplay of Matrix and Potentiator, Catalyst and Experience. The Significator of the Mind is the Hierophant (Card 5); of the Body is the Hanged Man (Card 12); of the Spirit is the Sun (Card 19).

keyPassages.excerpt: The Significator is the significant self, the complex of mind, body, or spirit which has within it the potential to become all things.

transformation.definition: An archetype representing the process of change and evolution through the integration of catalyst.
transformation.extendedDefinition: The Transformation archetype represents the change that occurs when catalyst is fully processed and integrated. It represents the choice between two paths and the resulting transformation. The Transformation of the Mind is the Lovers (Card 6), representing the choice between light and dark paths; of the Body is Death (Card 13); of the Spirit is Judgement (Card 20). Ra described it as 'the student of the mysteries being transformed by the need to choose.'

keyPassages.excerpt: As you observe Archetype Six you may see the student of the mysteries being transformed by the need to choose betwixt the light and the dark in mind.
keyPassages.context: Transformation of Mind as choosing between paths

great-way.definition: The archetype representing the integration of mind, body, and spirit on the spiritual journey.
great-way.extendedDefinition: The Great Way is the seventh archetype in each group, representing the full integration and expression of mind, body, or spirit. The Great Way of the Mind is the Chariot (Card 7); of the Body is Temperance (Card 14); of the Spirit is the World (Card 21). It shows the environment, milieu, and manner of the spiritual journey.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Great Way of the Mind, Body, or Spirit draws together all of the other archetypes of each complex and shows the manner of the spiritual journey.

tarot.definition: A system of images representing the archetypical mind. Ra designed the original tarot as a study tool for spiritual evolution.
tarot.extendedDefinition: The tarot's 22 Major Arcana are images representing the archetypes of the archetypical mind. Ra originally gave these images to the Egyptians as a study tool. Over time, they became distorted through use in divination. Ra recommends studying one system (tarot, astrology, or Tree of Life) in depth to understand the archetypical mind.

keyPassages.excerpt: The origin of this system of study and divination is twofold: firstly, there is that influence which, coming in a distorted fashion from those who were priests attempting to teach the Law of One in Egypt.

matrix-of-mind.definition: The first archetype (Tarot Card 1, The Magician). Represents the conscious mind in its unfed, new, and potent state, reaching for experience.
matrix-of-mind.extendedDefinition: The Matrix of the Mind is the conscious mind itself, male in nature, reaching without limit for that which it desires. It is depicted as a magician, the figure with all magical tools available, representing the conscious mind's inherent potential. The Matrix reaches but must be potentiated by the unconscious (High Priestess) to become fruitful.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Matrix of the Mind is that from which all comes. It is unmoving yet is the activator in potentiation of all mind activity.
keyPassages.context: Definition of Matrix of the Mind

keyPassages.excerpt: The Matrix of the Mind is the conscious mind and is further described as the Magician because of the power of the conscious mind to manipulate through will.

potentiator-of-mind.definition: The second archetype (Tarot Card 2, The High Priestess). Represents the unconscious mind, the great feminine repository of potential waiting to be accessed.
potentiator-of-mind.extendedDefinition: The Potentiator of the Mind is the unconscious or subconscious mind, female in nature and veiled. The High Priestess sits between the pillars of light and darkness, holding the scroll of wisdom. She potentiates the Matrix by offering the riches of the subconscious to the reaching conscious mind. The veil between conscious and unconscious is a key feature.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Potentiator of Mind reaches into the roots of the mind, offering the Matrix of Mind the possibility of knowing Itself.

catalyst-of-mind.definition: The third archetype (Tarot Card 3, The Empress). Represents catalyst as it acts upon the mind, the fertile ground of mental experience.
catalyst-of-mind.extendedDefinition: The Catalyst of the Mind is that which acts upon the consciousness to produce mental catalyst or experience. The Empress represents the fertile abundance of catalyst available to the conscious mind. Through the gateway opened by the Potentiator, catalyst flows into conscious experience. The Empress is shown pregnant, holding the scepter of power over catalyst.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Catalyst of the Mind represents the interaction of the conscious mind with the catalyst which has been processed by the subconscious mind and made available to the conscious mind.

experience-of-mind.definition: The fourth archetype (Tarot Card 4, The Emperor). Represents the experience processed by mind, the structuring of catalyst into meaningful experience.
experience-of-mind.extendedDefinition: The Experience of the Mind is the processing of catalyst into structured experience. The Emperor represents the ordering principle that takes raw catalyst and shapes it into experience. He sits upon his throne with symbols of structured power, showing how the mind processes and organizes the fertile catalyst of the Empress into usable experience.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Experience of the Mind then has the duty or function of examining that which is placed before it, accepting what is desired, rejecting what is not desired, and understanding what is found.

significator-of-mind.definition: The fifth archetype (Tarot Card 5, The Hierophant). Represents the complex of mind itself, the actor who uses catalyst and experience for evolution.
significator-of-mind.extendedDefinition: The Significator of the Mind represents the mind complex itself, the entity who processes catalyst and experience. The Hierophant is shown as a teacher figure between two pillars, with two students. This archetype signifies the mind's choice-making faculty and its role as the central processor of the mental experience. It is the 'actor' in the drama of mind.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Significator of the Mind represents the entire complex of consciousness which is available to the seeker or adept.

transformation-of-mind.definition: The sixth archetype (Tarot Card 6, The Lovers). Represents the transformation possible when the mind faces the choice between paths.
transformation-of-mind.extendedDefinition: The Transformation of the Mind represents the critical choice point where transformation becomes possible. The Lovers card shows the choice between paths - often depicted as a figure choosing between two others. This archetype shows how the mind can be transformed through making the fundamental choice of polarity. Without this choice, no transformation is possible.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Transformation of the Mind is the process through which the seeker chooses its polarity and transforms all previous experiences according to that choice.

great-way-of-mind.definition: The seventh archetype (Tarot Card 7, The Chariot). Represents the environment and summation of mind work, the triumphant progress of consciousness.
great-way-of-mind.extendedDefinition: The Great Way of the Mind represents the environment in which the mind complex functions and the culmination of mental evolution. The Chariot shows a figure in a vehicle of triumph, having conquered through the integration of all previous archetypes. The sphinxes or horses represent the balanced forces now under the direction of the will.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Great Way of the Mind depicts the environment in which the work of the mind is accomplished: within the chariot of progress, both horses of polarity pulling the seeker forward.

matrix-of-body.definition: The eighth archetype (Tarot Card 8, Justice). Represents the physical vehicle in its unrealized state, the body as continuation of consciousness.
matrix-of-body.extendedDefinition: The Matrix of the Body represents the physical vehicle and its inherent wisdom. Justice shows the balanced nature of the body - it simply is, without judgment. The body continues the consciousness of the mind into physical manifestation. Note: In Ra's ordering, Justice is Card 8 (following the older Marseilles tradition), not Strength.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Matrix of the Body may be seen to be a reflection in opposites of the mind; that is, unrestricted motion.

potentiator-of-body.definition: The ninth archetype (Tarot Card 9, The Hermit). Represents wisdom that potentiates the body, the inner light guiding physical existence.
potentiator-of-body.extendedDefinition: The Potentiator of the Body is the wisdom principle that activates the physical vehicle. The Hermit holds his lamp high, illuminating the path - representing the inner wisdom available to guide bodily experience. This archetype shows how inner wisdom potentiates and guides the body's journey through incarnation.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Potentiator of the Body is Wisdom. The body without wisdom is not capable of learning.

catalyst-of-body.definition: The tenth archetype (Tarot Card 10, Wheel of Fortune). Represents bodily catalyst, the turning circumstances that challenge the physical vehicle.
catalyst-of-body.extendedDefinition: The Catalyst of the Body represents the circumstances and events that act upon the body. The Wheel of Fortune shows the cyclic nature of bodily catalyst - health, illness, pleasure, pain, all turning on the wheel of physical existence. This archetype shows how the body receives and processes physical catalyst.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Catalyst of the Body concerns catalyst upon the physical vehicle which is not processed by the mind but directly upon the body complex.

experience-of-body.definition: The eleventh archetype (Tarot Card 11, Strength/Enchantress). Represents bodily experience, the taming and integration of physical energies.
experience-of-body.extendedDefinition: The Experience of the Body shows how the body processes and integrates physical catalyst. Strength (or the Enchantress in some traditions) depicts a figure gently handling a lion - representing the taming and integration of powerful physical energies. Ra calls this the Enchantress. Note: In Ra's ordering, Strength is Card 11, not Card 8.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Experience of the Body is symbolized by the Enchantress who, by the power of experience, tames the great cat.

significator-of-body.definition: The twelfth archetype (Tarot Card 12, The Hanged Man). Represents the body complex itself, suspended between worlds, sacrificing for transformation.
significator-of-body.extendedDefinition: The Significator of the Body represents the body complex as a whole - the physical vehicle through which consciousness experiences incarnation. The Hanged Man is suspended upside down, showing the reversal of perspective that bodily existence requires. The body is sacrificed to serve consciousness, hung between heaven and earth.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Significator of the Body is that which signifies the body complex, being suspended between the reaching for spirit and the pull of earth.

transformation-of-body.definition: The thirteenth archetype (Tarot Card 13, Death). Represents bodily transformation, the necessary death and rebirth of physical patterns.
transformation-of-body.extendedDefinition: The Transformation of the Body shows how the physical vehicle transforms through death and rebirth of patterns. Death shows the skeleton reaper harvesting - but this is transformation, not ending. Old physical patterns must die for new ones to emerge. This is the transformation that makes the body a more fitting vehicle for spirit.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Transformation of the Body is well indicated by the image of Death, for with the change to a more lightened body comes the seeming death of the grosser body.

great-way-of-body.definition: The fourteenth archetype (Tarot Card 14, Temperance). Represents the environment and summation of body work, the alchemical integration of physical existence.
great-way-of-body.extendedDefinition: The Great Way of the Body shows the environment in which bodily transformation occurs and its culmination. Temperance (or the Alchemist) depicts the mixing and balancing of essences - the integration of physical experiences into a refined whole. This is the alchemy of the body, the tempering process that creates a more perfected physical vehicle.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Great Way of the Body is called Temperance because it involves the tempering of the self through the integration of body, mind, and spirit.

matrix-of-spirit.definition: The fifteenth archetype (Tarot Card 15, The Devil). Represents the spirit in its bound state, the illusion of bondage that must be transcended.
matrix-of-spirit.extendedDefinition: The Matrix of the Spirit shows the spirit's initial condition - apparently bound but actually free. The Devil depicts figures in chains that are loose enough to remove, symbolizing the illusory nature of spiritual bondage. The Matrix of Spirit contains infinite potential but appears constrained by the illusions of incarnation.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Matrix of the Spirit is that which binds and frees spirit. It is the illusion of the chains which, when examined, are seen to be quite loose.

potentiator-of-spirit.definition: The sixteenth archetype (Tarot Card 16, The Tower). Represents the sudden influx of spirit that shatters illusion and false structures.
potentiator-of-spirit.extendedDefinition: The Potentiator of the Spirit is the lightning bolt of spiritual truth that shatters illusion. The Tower shows a structure struck by lightning, figures falling - representing the destruction of false constructs by spiritual illumination. This sudden potentiation frees the spirit from its apparent bondage in the Matrix.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Potentiator of the Spirit is that which, in its sudden and inevitable lightnings, shatters the illusion of the Devil.

catalyst-of-spirit.definition: The seventeenth archetype (Tarot Card 17, The Star). Represents spiritual catalyst, the hope and guidance that draws the spirit forward.
catalyst-of-spirit.extendedDefinition: The Catalyst of the Spirit is the hope and faith that catalyzes spiritual growth. The Star shows a figure pouring water while a bright star shines above - representing the catalyst of hope, inspiration, and spiritual guidance. After the Tower's destruction, the Star offers the catalyst of renewed faith and direction.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Catalyst of the Spirit is Hope, also called Faith. This is the star that beckons the spirit onwards.

experience-of-spirit.definition: The eighteenth archetype (Tarot Card 18, The Moon). Represents spiritual experience, the navigation through darkness and illusion by inner light.
experience-of-spirit.extendedDefinition: The Experience of the Spirit shows how spirit experiences and processes catalyst in the realm of shadow and illusion. The Moon illuminates a path between towers, with creatures emerging from water - representing the journey through the unconscious, the dark night of the soul, and the navigation by pale reflected light. Experience of Spirit involves facing shadows.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Experience of the Spirit is that of the soul walking through darkness, guided by the pale light of the moon.

significator-of-spirit.definition: The nineteenth archetype (Tarot Card 19, The Sun). Represents the spirit complex itself, radiant consciousness illuminating all.
significator-of-spirit.extendedDefinition: The Significator of the Spirit represents the spirit complex in its true nature - radiant, joyful, illuminating. The Sun shows bright light, often with children playing - representing the pure joy and radiance of spirit when freed from illusion. This is spirit knowing itself as light, illuminating all it touches.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Significator of the Spirit is the Sun, showing forth the brilliance of that spirit which has discovered its own nature.

transformation-of-spirit.definition: The twentieth archetype (Tarot Card 20, Judgement). Represents spiritual transformation, the resurrection and renewal of spirit.
transformation-of-spirit.extendedDefinition: The Transformation of the Spirit shows the spirit's complete transformation and resurrection. Judgement depicts figures rising from graves at an angel's call - representing spiritual rebirth, the calling forth of the true self, and the transformation from bounded to unbounded awareness. This is spirit transformed by its journey.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Transformation of the Spirit is the resurrection, the calling forth by the angelic to that which has lain in spirit's tomb.

great-way-of-spirit.definition: The twenty-first archetype (Tarot Card 21, The World). Represents the environment and summation of spirit work, wholeness and completion.
great-way-of-spirit.extendedDefinition: The Great Way of the Spirit shows the environment of spiritual work and its culmination in wholeness. The World depicts a dancing figure within a wreath, surrounded by the four elements or evangelists - representing the complete integration of spirit with all aspects of creation. This is spirit's recognition of itself as all things.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Great Way of the Spirit is the World, or the dancing soul rejoicing in its completion and wholeness.

meditation.definition: The practice of silencing the mind to contact intelligent infinity. Ra considers it the single most important practice for seekers.
meditation.extendedDefinition: Meditation is the practice of silencing the chattering mind to make contact with intelligent infinity. Ra considers meditation the single most important practice for spiritual seekers. Through regular meditation, one learns to still the mind, access deeper consciousness, and eventually contact intelligent infinity through the indigo ray gateway.

keyPassages.excerpt: The proper role of the entity is in this density to experience all things desired, to then analyze, understand, and accept these experiences, distilling from them the love/light within them. Nothing shall be overcome. That which is not needed falls away.
keyPassages.context: The purpose of meditation and contemplation

balancing.definition: The process of accepting all experiences and emotions without judgment, integrating catalyst to find equilibrium.
balancing.extendedDefinition: Balancing is the practice of accepting and integrating all experiences, emotions, and aspects of self. When an emotion arises, one allows it fully, then visualizes its opposite, then allows both to exist together, finding the point of balance. This practice accelerates spiritual evolution by processing catalyst efficiently.

keyPassages.excerpt: The purpose of the Confederation is service. Each day you serve the Creator. Each day you accept the light and emit it.

healing.definition: The restoration of balance and wholeness. True healing occurs when a being realizes its unity with the Creator.
healing.extendedDefinition: Healing is the restoration of balance and the realization of the entity's perfection. True healing occurs when the entity realizes its unity with the Creator - all blockages are distortions of this unity. A healer serves as a channel for intelligent energy, offering the opportunity for the one to be healed to accept the healing.

keyPassages.excerpt: The healing ability, like all other, what this instrument would call paranormal abilities, is effected by the opening of a pathway or shuttle into intelligent infinity.

adept.definition: One who has mastered the personality and can consciously work with intelligent energy for transformation and service.
adept.extendedDefinition: An adept is one who has balanced the personality through disciplined practice and can work consciously with intelligent energy and intelligent infinity. The adept works with the indigo ray, accessing the gateway to intelligent infinity for healing, magical work, and service. Adepthood is not about power but about service and transformation.

keyPassages.excerpt: The adept is one which will go beyond the green ray which signals entry into harvestability. The adept will not simply be tapping into intelligent energy as a means of readiness for harvest but tapping into both intelligent energy and intelligent infinity.

magical-personality.definition: The higher self accessed through disciplined practice, enabling the adept to work with intelligent infinity.
magical-personality.extendedDefinition: The magical personality is the integration of the self with the higher self that occurs through disciplined adept work. When invoked through ritual and intention, the magical personality channels the power of intelligent infinity for work in consciousness. It is not separate from the self but is the self's fullest expression.

keyPassages.excerpt: The magical personality is that which is the adept when it has become at one with its higher self.

seeking.definition: The spiritual journey of searching for truth and unity. Ra emphasizes that the desire to seek is the key that opens doors.
seeking.extendedDefinition: Seeking is the spiritual journey of searching for truth, understanding, and unity with the Creator. Ra emphasizes that the desire to seek is itself the key that opens all doors. The intensity of seeking determines the opportunities that arise for learning. A true seeker approaches with humility, knowing that the journey itself is the destination.

keyPassages.excerpt: We may suggest that the vitality of seeking, the will to know, and the intensity of the desire for the truth be the foundation for seeking.

Ra.definition: A sixth-density social memory complex from Venus who contacted Earth to balance karma incurred when their teachings to Egypt were distorted.
Ra.extendedDefinition: Ra is a sixth-density social memory complex that evolved on the planet Venus. They have a long history with Earth, having walked among Egyptians approximately 11,000 years ago to share the Law of One. They built structures including the Great Pyramid of Giza as healing and initiation chambers. However, their teachings were distorted by the elite, creating karma Ra felt obligated to balance. The Law of One sessions (1981-1984) represent Ra's most recent attempt to share their message through a narrow-band channel requiring deep trance. Ra describes themselves as 'humble messengers of the Law of One' who continue to walk the many steps of adepthood.

keyPassages.excerpt: We are those who are of the Law of One. In our vibration the polarities are harmonized, the complexities are simplified, and the paradoxes have their solution. We are one.

We came to your peoples to enunciate the Law of One. We wished to impress upon those who wished to learn of unity that in unity all paradoxes are resolved; all that is broken is healed; all that is forgotten is brought to light.

confederation.definition: A group of positive entities from many planets who serve the One Creator by helping third-density planets like Earth.
confederation.extendedDefinition: The Confederation of Planets in the Service of the Infinite Creator is an alliance of approximately 53 civilizations comprising around 500 planetary consciousness complexes. Members include entities from many densities who have joined in service according to the Law of One. They work to assist planets approaching harvest while respecting free will.

keyPassages.excerpt: There are approximately fifty-three civilizations, comprising approximately five hundred planetary consciousness complexes in this Confederation.
keyPassages.context: Size and composition of the Confederation

orion.definition: A group of negatively-oriented entities who seek to serve self through control and manipulation of others.
orion.extendedDefinition: The Orion group is a collective of negatively-polarized entities who seek to serve self through conquering and enslaving others. They work through the creation of elites and hierarchies. They cannot directly infringe on free will but work through mental influence, particularly targeting wanderers. Their goal is to bring others into their empire.

keyPassages.excerpt: The purpose of the Orion group, as mentioned before, is conquest and enslavement. This is done by finding and establishing an elite and causing others to serve the elite.

council-of-saturn.definition: A governing body located in Saturn's rings that oversees affairs in this solar system, including Earth's quarantine.
council-of-saturn.extendedDefinition: The Council of Saturn is a governing body located in the eighth dimension in the rings of Saturn. They oversee affairs in this solar system, including maintaining Earth's quarantine and approving requests from higher density entities to interact with third density Earth. The Council balances free will with the need for protection.

keyPassages.excerpt: This Council is located in the octave, or eight[h] dimension, of the planet Saturn, taking its place in an area which you understand in third-dimensional terms as the rings.

guardians.definition: Higher-density beings who protect the free will of planetary populations by maintaining a quarantine.
guardians.extendedDefinition: The Guardians are higher-density beings who protect the free will of third-density populations. They maintain Earth's quarantine, preventing direct mass contact from either the Confederation or the Orion group. The quarantine allows for balanced opportunity between positive and negative influences while protecting free will.

keyPassages.excerpt: The Guardians guard the free will distortion of the mind/body/spirit complexes of third density on this planetary sphere.

quarantine.definition: The barrier around Earth maintained by Guardians to protect free will by limiting direct contact from higher-density entities.
quarantine.extendedDefinition: The quarantine is a protective barrier around Earth maintained by the Guardians to protect the free will of third-density entities. It limits direct contact from both the Confederation and the Orion group, allowing balanced opportunity for choice. Windows occasionally open in the quarantine due to dimensional balancing, allowing limited contact.

keyPassages.excerpt: In order to balance the dimensional variances in vibration, a quarantine was set up, this being a balancing situation whereby the free will of the Orion group is not stopped but given a challenge.

forgiveness.definition: The stopping of karmic inertia through understanding and acceptance. Essential for spiritual progress.
forgiveness.extendedDefinition: Forgiveness is the principle that stops the inertia of karma. It is inseparable from karma - where karma is the continuation of imbalanced action, forgiveness is the brake. Both self and other-selves can invoke forgiveness at any time to stop karmic patterns. True forgiveness comes from understanding and acceptance.

keyPassages.excerpt: This stoppage of the inertia of action may be called forgiveness. These two concepts are inseparable.
keyPassages.context: Forgiveness as the brake on karma

keyPassages.excerpt: Thus one who has set in motion an action may forgive itself and never again make that error. This also brakes or stops what you call karma.

honor-duty.definition: The responsibility one feels toward the Creator and creation, balanced with wisdom to know when and how to serve.
honor-duty.extendedDefinition: Honor/duty represents the intertwined nature of privilege and responsibility in spiritual service. Each honor carries responsibility; each responsibility is an honor. At fifth density, conscious acceptance of honor/duty of the Law of One is required for graduation. It represents the balance of serving with wisdom.

keyPassages.excerpt: The fifth-density harvest is of those whose vibratory distortions consciously accept the honor/duty of the Law of One. This responsibility/honor is the foundation of this vibration.
Each responsibility is an honor; each honor, a responsibility.
keyPassages.context: Reciprocal nature of honor and duty

seniority-of-vibration.definition: A system where souls with longer experience in this creation incarnate first during harvest times, displacing younger souls.
seniority-of-vibration.extendedDefinition: Seniority of vibration is the system by which incarnation priority is determined during harvest times. Entities with longer experience within this particular creation have priority for incarnation, as they have more potential to achieve harvest. This results in younger souls being displaced from incarnation during these critical periods.

keyPassages.excerpt: This is due to the intense interest in the experiential possibilities of third density at the time of harvest.
keyPassages.context: Why seniority of vibration occurs at harvest

the-choice.definition: The 22nd archetype (Tarot Card 22/0, The Fool) and fundamental third-density decision between service to others and service to self, determining the path of spiritual evolution.
the-choice.extendedDefinition: The Choice is the axis upon which creation turns, represented in the tarot as The Fool. It is built into the blueprint of third-density experience through the archetypal mind. The Fool steps off the cliff, representing the leap of faith required to make the fundamental choice. By making this choice through catalytically intense, multi-incarnational third density, the 'statue is forged in the fire.' The work of subsequent densities is refining this 'rough-hewn sculpture.' For the positive path, the seeker knows, accepts, forgives, balances, and opens the self in love.

keyPassages.excerpt: This game can only be won by those who lose their cards in the melting influence of love; can only be won by those who lay their pleasures, their limitations, their all upon the table face up and say inwardly: 'All, all of you players, each other-self, whatever your hand, I love you.' This is the game: to know, to accept, to forgive, to balance, and to open the self in love.
keyPassages.context: Ra's metaphor of life as a card game won through love

keyPassages.excerpt: The Choice, Archetype 22, is the Significator of the Spirit. It is the stepping off place from which the spirit views the cosmos.
keyPassages.context: The Fool as the Choice archetype

faith.definition: A faculty of the indigo ray that serves as the bridge to infinity, the doorway to mystery—that which transcends the limitations of mind, body, and the illusion itself.
faith.extendedDefinition: Faith is congruent with intelligent infinity. Ra defines it as 'the ability to allow and accept changes through the violet ray into the gateway of intelligent energy.' The counterpart to faith is the will; each faculty strengthens and energizes the other as they are applied in everyday life, especially via meditative discipline. Consciousness disciplined by will and faith may contact intelligent infinity directly.

keyPassages.excerpt: The vibratory distortion of sound, faith, is perhaps one of the stumbling blocks between those of what we may call the infinite path and those of the finite proving-understanding. You are precisely correct in your understanding of the congruency of faith and intelligent infinity.
keyPassages.context: Ra on faith's relationship to intelligent infinity

keyPassages.excerpt: Consciousness which has been disciplined by will and faith is that consciousness which may contact intelligent infinity directly.

will.definition: The faculty and power within each mind/body/spirit complex to direct, orient, and author their return journey to the One Infinite Creator.
will.extendedDefinition: With the will awakened, carefully directed, and exercised in conjunction with faith, the entity may use catalyst to know itself, polarize, and become the Creator. Ra called will 'that which is powerful within you as co-Creator' and 'the great conduit to the Creator.' The will is strengthened through focused attention and concentration, particularly through meditation. It must be carefully used and directed in service to others for those on the positive path.

keyPassages.excerpt: Your faculty of will is that which is powerful within you as co-Creator. You cannot ascribe to this faculty too much importance. Thus it must be carefully used and directed in service to others for those upon the positively oriented path.
keyPassages.context: Ra on the power and responsibility of will

keyPassages.excerpt: There is but one technique for this growing or nurturing of will and faith, and that is the focusing of the attention.
keyPassages.context: How to strengthen will and faith

discipline-of-personality.definition: The paramount work of those consciously aware of the process of evolution: to know yourself, accept yourself, and become the Creator.
discipline-of-personality.extendedDefinition: The heart of the discipline of the personality is threefold: One, know yourself. Two, accept yourself. Three, become the Creator. For the positive path, this results in whole knowledge of the self in micro- and macrocosm, and in finely tuned compassion and love which sees all things as love. The disciplined entity has access to all things—the discipline which opens the universes opens also the gateways to evolution.

keyPassages.excerpt: The heart of the discipline of the personality is threefold. One, know yourself. Two, accept yourself. Three, become the Creator. The third step is that step which, when accomplished, renders one the most humble servant of all, transparent in personality and completely able to know and accept other-selves.
keyPassages.context: Ra's core teaching on personality discipline

gateway-to-intelligent-infinity.definition: The indigo ray functioning as a portal through which intelligent infinity may be contacted and intelligent energy brought through for service.
gateway-to-intelligent-infinity.extendedDefinition: Opening the gateway reliably requires the will to serve, the will to seek, the faculty of faith, activation and stable balance of the preceding energy centers, considerable work in the discipline of the personality, and for the positive entity, the springboard of universal love: the open heart. The adept works through the gateway for self-discovery, dismantling the veil, releasing the illusion of the separate self, and becoming the Creator.

keyPassages.excerpt: The purpose of carefully and consciously opening this channel is to serve in a more dependable way, in a more commonplace or usual way. To others there may appear to be miracles. To the one who has carefully opened the door to intelligent infinity this is ordinary; this is commonplace; this is as it should be.
keyPassages.context: Ra on the purpose of opening the gateway

primal-distortion.definition: The three foundational distortions from which every subsequent distortion springs: Free Will, Love (Logos), and Light.
primal-distortion.extendedDefinition: Everything in creation is a distortion of the pure, undistorted intelligent infinity. The three Primal Distortions emerge from intelligent infinity in sequence: First Distortion is Free Will (Law of Confusion), Second Distortion is Love (Logos, the Creative Principle), Third Distortion is Light. From these three come all hierarchies of distortions. The Primal Distortions constitute the creation story—the cosmic genesis of the universe. They exist within the heart of the self at all times.

keyPassages.excerpt: In the sense of the activity of Unity in its free will, Love uses Light and has the power to direct light in its distortions. Thus vibratory complexes recapitulate in reverse the creation in its unity, thus showing the rhythm or flow of the great heartbeat.
keyPassages.context: How the primal distortions work together

seven-bodies.definition: The seven vehicles for learning, movement, and experience, each corresponding to a density and energy center, from less to more densely packed with light.
seven-bodies.extendedDefinition: The seven bodies are: Red-Ray (elemental/chemical body), Orange-Ray (physical body without self-awareness), Yellow-Ray (the activated physical vehicle in third density), Green-Ray (astral body, fourth-density vehicle), Blue-Ray (devachanic body/body of light), Indigo-Ray (etheric/gateway/form-maker body), and Violet-Ray (Buddha body, complete body). The indigo-ray body is the first activated upon death and plays a critical role in health and healing.

keyPassages.excerpt: The indigo-ray body may be described as being intelligent energy. It is, however, that which may mold itself as it desires in order to manifest in the experience of third density the infinite potential of Intelligent Infinity.

calling.definition: The request for assistance emitted from an entity, which attracts the attention of those who respond to such calls.
calling.extendedDefinition: The call need not be verbalized or even consciously formulated—one's state of need, pain, or seeking may constitute a calling. The Confederation of Planets responds only to calls, awaiting the request as they honor free will. The Orion Empire, by contrast, calls itself to offer conquest and service-to-self teaching. The mathematics of calling means the second call doubles the first, the third doubles the second, and so forth.

keyPassages.excerpt: The One Being of the creation is like unto a body. Would we ignore a pain in the leg? A bruise upon the skin? A cut which is festering? No. There is no ignoring a call. We, the entities of sorrow, choose as our service the attempt to heal the sorrow which we are calling analogous to the pains of a physical body complex distortion.
keyPassages.context: Why the Confederation responds to calls

crystallization.definition: The state in which energy centers become regularized and stable through consistent work in consciousness, able to carry higher voltage energy.
crystallization.extendedDefinition: Through the discipline of the personality, energy centers become crystalline, forming unique structures capable of carrying greater energy into the system. Like a crystal that is strong without effort, regular, and radiant, the crystallized entity processes catalyst without splintering or breaking.
